intro: Odontotrichum tridactylitis, commonly known as the three-toed sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. The plant thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its morphology includes a compact rosette structure, which helps reduce water loss in its extreme habitat. Odontotrichum tridactylitis is often found in tundra and mountainous areas across Europe and Asia.
